attributes.action:
Rishi Sunak 
Call a National Emergency with all these immigrants NOW
attributes.additional_details: it is not humanitarian to keep giving people hotels and various places to live when our own people and veterans are homeless!
attributes.background: We want the government to call a National Emergency as peoples lives are being seriously affected by the amount of immigration.  Calling a National Emergency will stop any more boats arriving on our shores!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about immigration into the UK, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

The Civil Contingencies Act 2004 allows for the making of temporary special legislation (emergency regulations) to help deal with the most serious of emergencies, but we're not sure what action you want the Government to use these powers to take.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
